intro: Cineraria arctotidea, commonly known as the alpine cineraria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and delicate species.
